translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
The Chapter with Kuṇḍadhāna
The Elder Sāgata’s Birth Story🔽“At that time, I was a brahmin
named Sobhita.
Leading a group of disciples,
I went to a monastery.
At that time, the Blessed One,

analyzed: bhikkhu saṅgha purakkhato  ārāma dvārā nikkhamma
translated: surrounded by the Saṅgha of bhikkhus,🔽came out of the monastery gate
and stood there, the most excellent of men.
I saw the Fully Enlightened One,
surrounded by those with tamed senses.
Having gladdened my own mind,
I conversed with the Leader of the World.
All those who are trees
grow out of the earth.
In the same way, wise beings
grow in the Dispensation of the Victor.
You are a wise caravan leader
for many people, Great Sage.
Having lifted them out of the wilderness,
you show them the path.
You are tamed, surrounded by the tamed,
a meditator, together with those who delight in meditation.
You are ardent, with a devoted mind,
peaceful, restrained, and cool.
Your assembly is adorned,
shining with merit and knowledge.
Your radiance shines forth,
like the rising sun.
Seeing the faithful mind,
the Great Seer Padumuttara;
The Teacher, standing in the midst of the Community of monks,

original: imā gāthā abhāsatha.🔽‘Yo so hāsaṁ janetvāna,
analyzed: imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāsatha  yaḥ saḥ hāsam
translated: recited these verses.🔽‘The brahmin who, after making me laugh,
praised me,
will for a hundred thousand aeons
delight in the world of the gods.
Having fallen from the Tusita heaven,
urged on by the root of merit,
he will go forth in the Dispensation🔽of the Fortunate Gotama.
By that well-done deed,
he will attain Liberation;
his name will be Sāgata,
a disciple of the Teacher.’
Having gone forth, with my body🔽I avoided bad deeds;
having given up bad conduct by speech,
I purified my livelihood.
Dwelling in this way,
I became skilled in the fire element;
having fully understood all the pollutants,
I dwell without pollutants.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Awakened One has said.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā sāgato thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā sāgataḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the venerable Sāgata, the Elder, recited these verses.
The Story of the Elder Sāgata, the Second.
